alert.note: Alert for Marin Coastal Range; North Bay Interior Mountains; North Bay Interior Valleys; Sonoma Coastal Range (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 3:36PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MARIN... SOUTHEASTERN SONOMA AND SOUTHWESTERN NAPA COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM PST... At 336 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Petaluma, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Rosa, Petaluma, Novato, Rohnert Park, Windsor, Sonoma, Sebastopol, Cotati, St. Helena, Calistoga, Roseland, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Larkfield-Wikiup, Boyes Hot Springs, Forestville, Eldridge, Graton, El Verano, Glen Ellen, and Temelec. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Marin Coastal Range; North Bay Interior Mountains; North Bay Interior Valleys; Sonoma Coastal Range
